title: JointDamping physics regression test is brittle

content.raw:
While adding code to PhysicsTest.SpawnDropCoGOffset physics regression test (commit 5e24c19), I managed to cause a failure of PhysicsTest.JointDampingTest.
~~~
[ RUN      ] PhysicsTest.JointDampingTest
Gazebo multi-robot simulator, version 1.4.6
...
/home/scpeters/osrf/gazebo/test/regression/physics.cc:584: Failure
Expected: (vel.z) > (-6.51768), actual: -6.5177 vs -6.51768
[  FAILED  ] PhysicsTest.JointDampingTest (2675 ms)
~~~

It's probably a simple matter of adjusting the tolerances on the JointDamping test, but it's strange that adding code to a different test caused this failure.

While adding code to PhysicsTest.SpawnDropCoGOffset physics regression test (commit 5e24c19), I managed to cause a failure of PhysicsTest.JointDampingTest.

[ RUN      ] PhysicsTest.JointDampingTest
Gazebo multi-robot simulator, version 1.4.6
...
/home/scpeters/osrf/gazebo/test/regression/physics.cc:584: Failure
Expected: (vel.z) > (-6.51768), actual: -6.5177 vs -6.51768
[  FAILED  ] PhysicsTest.JointDampingTest (2675 ms)

It's probably a simple matter of adjusting the tolerances on the JointDamping test, but it's strange that adding code to a different test caused this failure.
